thread.title: College football: Southern Utah, without Crowton, faces Sacramento State
thread.title_full: College football: Southern Utah, without Crowton, faces Sacramento State | The Salt Lake Tribune

author: STEVE LUHM
title: College football: Southern Utah, without Crowton, faces Sacramento State
text:
Cedar City • Southern Utah begins life without Gary Crowton on Saturday night against Sacramento State.
Crowton, the Thunderbirds' former offensive coordinator, left the program two weeks ago for personal reasons. Justin Walterscheid, the previous assistant offensive coordinator and receivers coach, has replaced him.
"There is a lot of adversity with the change," Southern Utah coach Ed Lamb said. "I have tremendous confidence in our team and in Justin. We're not changing anything. But every coordinator brings a little bit different perspective."
According to Lamb, he still doesn't know all the details behind Crowton's decision to step away.
  "He's played it very close to the vest," Lamb said, "but it was not a case of … us getting rid of him. Personally, I was devastated because of what coach [Crowton] has meant to me and what he offered our program."
Southern Utah comes off a bye week. The Thunderbirds are 3-2 overall and 2-0 in the Big Sky Conference. They are one of two teams that remain unbeaten in league play. The other is Eastern Washington.
"I hope we're not paying too much attention to the conference standings right now," Lamb said. "It's very early."
